intro: Lasianthus kbangensis, commonly known as the Kbangensis flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lasianthus kbangensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
